Generation VII.Sun: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever this Pokémon spits fire.
Generation VII.Moon: It boasts powerful front legs. With a single punch, it can bend an iron bar right over.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It can act spoiled if it grows close to its Trainer. A powerful Pokémon, its sharp claws can leave its Trainer's whole body covered in scratches.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: When its mane is standing on end, you can tell it's feeling good. When it isn't feeling well, its fur will lie down flat.

Generation VIII.Sword: In the midst of battle, the fire pouch on Torracat's neck rings like a bell and produces stronger flames than usual. *
Generation VIII.Shield: When facing a powerful enemy, Torracat's fighting spirit gets pumped up, and its fire bell blazes hotter. *

Generation IX.Scarlet: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever fire spews out.
Generation IX.Violet: Torracat will let its Trainer coddle it once they’ve grown close, but it’s a powerful, sharp-clawed Pokémon, so its Trainer gets covered in scratches.
